tasks.title: TLS Delivery Manual Data Entry
tasks.description: Mr. Jaime Wong Chung requested TLS data on July 21st, 2025. Now that the TLS is functioning properly, the process has become easier. However, while it was down, we had to manually copy data from the delivery sheets. This led to some mistakes, so we had to double-check everything and recalculate the correct TLS values. We need to be more careful with these types of documents and situations to avoid similar issues in the future.

tasks.title: FON Prime Training Sessions
tasks.description: Over three days, Alexandre Silva from GVR trained Saawan, Dario, Javier, Vincent, and Roberto on all FuelOnet Prime functionalities to help PLG provide better information to the client about this new platform.

tasks.title: DB250, DB248 Bowsers online and uploading data
tasks.description: Now bowsers 250 and 248 are now connected and are uploading data correctly.

tasks.title: GVR Creation of Limit Rules Regarding Tank Capacity for All Migrated Fleet to FON by GVR Team
tasks.description: During the training sessions with Silva, a security concern was raised. Silva informed us that the tank capacity field does not restrict equipment from refueling beyond its capacity. To prevent this, limit rules should be created based on different tank capacities. It was agreed with Silva that his team will handle the migrated fleet, while new entries will be managed by us.

tasks.title: DB251 Delivery issues
tasks.description: Bowser 251 is having problems delivering to certain equipment. Tests with DataFlex360 FMS should be performed to verify its String ID

tasks.title: C2FT-004 Genset Issues with DB251
tasks.description: A test using bowsers other than the FON units (DB251 and DB252) was requested and is still pending.

tasks.title: Fake Bypass alarm fixing
tasks.description: A new automation update for the pump controller by the GVR Team was recently deployed. The Truck Prime UX installed in DB251 and DB252 is triggering a bypass alarm every time refueling starts. When one pump turns off, the system mistakenly identifies it as a bypass. A fix has been requested from GVR to ensure real alarms are accurately detected.
